thread.title: PSG weigh up move to take Michy Batshuayi back to France as striker remains out of favour at Chelsea
thread.title_full: PSG weigh up move to take Michy Batshuayi back to France as striker remains out of favour at Chelsea

author: Tom Hopkinson
title: PSG weigh up move to take Michy Batshuayi back to France as striker remains out of favour at Chelsea
text:
Sport PSG weigh up move to take Michy Batshuayi back to France as striker remains out of favour at Chelsea The striker has struggled for opportunities since arriving from Marseille and Antonio Conte will consider letting him go this month if he can find a replacement Share PSG are keen to take the Belgian striker back to France (Photo: REX/Shutterstock) Share Get Chelsea FC     
Paris Saint-Germain are considering a move for Chelsea misfit Michy Batshuayi. 
The Blues shelled out £33.2million to sign the 23-year-old from Marseille in the summer. 
But he is yet to start a Premier League game and now boss Antonio Conte will consider offers if he can bring in a replacement this month. 
Premier League rivals Swansea and West Ham have already shown an interest in the player. 
The Hammers were one of the clubs in for him in the summer until Chelsea pipped them to his signature. Batshuayi in action against Leicester (Photo: Darren Walsh) The striker has found his opportunities limited (Photo: Reuters) 
However, French giants PSG are ready to offer him a return to Ligue 1 and if they escalate their interest to a firm offer then Batshuayi will snub moves to the London or Liberty stadiums. 
The Belgium international is a proven goalscorer in the French league — he scored 26 goals in 38 games in his two-season stay at the Olympic Stadium. 
Marseille’s great rivals PSG are desperate for goals after a disappointing first half of the season which sees them third, behind leaders Nice and second-placed Monaco. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
